author: shamatar
content: My two cents is I’m strictly for evm384 iff implementations of particular useful operations (pairing, etc) can be made gas(!) efficient taking into the account the full EVM. Otherwise 100k USD saved on audits of the  precompile implementation in a client will lead to millions of potential losses by end users due to inefficiencies. My second largest concern is how to compare a complexity of a theoretical optimizing compiler for evm384 based implementation against the complexity of the cryptographic library written in an “older” language?

author: shamatar
content: So native code precompile is kind of known and better understood way to add things, especially if we assume it will be called frequently
